Software System: the ASPERA-3 Processing and Archiving Facility (APAF) ground data system
Each of the seven components described above
Intermediate files of cleaned-up ASPERA-3 and MEX OA telemetry
The ASPERA-3 and MEX OA telemetry data
The ASPERA-3 and MEX OA IDFS data sets
Any APAF-generated intermediate files of ASPERA-3 and MEX OA cleaned-up telemetry
There shall be a UNIX-based APAF system production computer
The mnemonic, LR, is used in the requirement identifiers
There are no safety requirements of the APAF ground data system
Environment Object: a UNIX-based APAF system production computer
ASPERA-3 and MEX OA cleaned-up telemetry
External System: Mission Operations and Data Analysis (MO&DA) phase
System Requirements: process all of the ASPERA-3 telemetry

provide data processing algorithms and support to IRF for the ASPERA-3 science team (including Co-I’s) in preparation for the Mission Operations and Data Analysis (MO&DA) phase of the Mars Express mission
acquire from ESOC the telemetry data of the ASPERA-3 Experiment and Mars Express Orbit/Attitude to automatically process the data on a daily basis
shall be stored on a local SwRI archive for data availability and re-processing.
stored on a local SwRI archive
be provided for public view to monitor instrument performance
be provided where any available ASPERA-3 data (as opposed to just the most current) can be used for science analysis to support the ASPERA-3 team in meeting mission goals and objectives
built-in error handling for better data integrity
There shall be a UNIX-based APAF system production computer with an archival system
software support for the APAF system
calibrated and validated prior to depositing in the NASA PDS
the APAF data system is not required to operate in more than one state or mode.

Some of the software quality factors that will be considered when developing the APAF data system include: reliability, maintainability, availability, flexibility, portability, testability, and usability.
Shared Phenomena: There shall be a UNIX-based APAF system production computer with an archival system
meeting MEX mission goals and objectives
